docs.snippet: Snap Inc, the newly renamed parent company of messaging app Snapchat, plans to start selling camera-equipped sunglasses starting this fall, Chief Executive Evan Spiegel told the Wall Street Journal in an interview....
docs.lead_paragraph: Snap Inc, the newly renamed parent company of messaging app Snapchat, plans to start selling camera-equipped sunglasses starting this fall, Chief Executive Evan Spiegel told the Wall Street Journal in an interview.

headline.print_headline: Snapchat to Offer Camera-Equipped Sunglasses in First Hardware Push

docs.snippet: Are tech companies like Uber, Google and Facebook ethically challenged?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Are tech companies like Uber, Google and Facebook ethically challenged?
docs.abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column holds that fierce competition, big money and lack of government oversight has contributed to ethical lapses in tech industry; says ethical shortcomings, like playing fast and loose with customer data, can eventually catch up with successful companies, who would do well to keep consumer in mind while chasing business success.

headline.main: The Slippery Slope of Silicon Valley

docs.snippet: A former employee has dragged Snapchat to court accusing the messaging app of misleading investors and trading partners to drive up its initial public offering, the Hollywood Reporter said citing a court document....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former employee has dragged Snapchat to court accusing the messaging app of misleading investors and trading partners to drive up its initial public offering, the Hollywood Reporter said citing a court document.

headline.main: Ex-Employee Sues Snapchat, Alleges It Misled Investors: Hollywood Reporter
headline.print_headline: Ex-Employee Sues Snapchat, Alleges It Misled Investors: Hollywood Reporter

docs.snippet: Uber is leaving China; fantasy sports are returning to New York; and, for better or worse, Facebook will control what headlines you see....
docs.lead_paragraph: Uber is leaving China; fantasy sports are returning to New York; and, for better or worse, Facebook will control what headlines you see.

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: Facebook’s Headline Rules

byline.original: By FARHAD MANJOO and MIKE ISAAC

docs.snippet: As more tech firms employ their own editing staffs, they are being viewed as something less than news organizations, but more than simple reflections of their growing audiences....
docs.lead_paragraph: As more tech firms employ their own editing staffs, they are being viewed as something less than news organizations, but more than simple reflections of their growing audiences.
docs.abstract: Facebook, Twitter and other social media companies are increasing their roles as news and entertainment curators, filling in gaps left by conventional news organizations and hiring editorial specialists to determine platform content; widening influence leads to questions regarding how content is chosen, with some speculating that companies could face new level of scrutiny.

headline.main: Social Media Finds New Role as News and Entertainment Curator
headline.print_headline: Social Media Takes On New Role as News and Entertainment Curator

docs.snippet: Upstarts are attracting millions of followers, some at a greater rate than Twitter, and most of these services have something that is harder to pinpoint and that money can’t buy — an element of cool, an intangible factor that makes them more a...
docs.abstract: Upstarts are attracting millions of followers, some at a greater rate than Twitter, and most of these services have something that is harder to pinpoint and that money can’t buy — an element of cool, an intangible factor that makes them more appealing than their predecessors.

headline.main: Daily Report: Twitter Rivals Seek Share of Social Media Pie

headline.main: Snap’s I.P.O. Bankers Also Helped Bring Alibaba to Market

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

docs.snippet: Facebook and other companies have struggled with how wearers of the device could have a good experience with their apps tailored to a small screen....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook and other companies have struggled with how wearers of the device could have a good experience with their apps tailored to a small screen.
docs.abstract: Investors, tech followers, analysts and app developers are eager to see what Apple's next earnings report has to say about market for the Apple Watch; outcome will affect degree to which companies focus on creating watch-friendly apps; Facebook, Snapchat and Google have yet to produce Apple Watch apps, which would in turn make consumers more likely to buy the product.

headline.main: Apple Waits as App Developers Study Who’s Buying Its Watch
headline.print_headline: Apple Waits as App Developers Study Who’s Buying Its Watch

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and VINDU GOEL
